THE SATURDAY EVENING POST
Aprils. 1954
Enjoy the luxurious lower-deck lounge on The President:
double-decked "Strato" Clippers. Or choose The Rainbow,
popular tourist service with giant "Super-6" Clippers. More
flights, more often, direct to more cities in Europe by Pan Am!
You're on the most popular
airline to EUROPE
when you choose Pan American
IO times every day giant Pan American Clippers span the Atlantic.
They've carried more passengers, 650,000 - and made more crossings, 44,500—
than any other airline.
You get the feeling the moment you board your
Clipper* that Pan Am knows how to run an airline.
It's not alone the snap and precision of ground per-
sonnel, the superb airmanship of U. S. air crews, the
luxurious Clippers, the frequency and convenience of
flights-it's also the sure, understanding way in which
you are treated, with hospitality, with friendliness, and
with attentive consideration.
Attention to each passenger's needs, plus an unmatched
record of air pioneering and leadership-that's what
makes Pan Am the choice of experienced travelers.
Call your Travel Agent or Pan American for reser-
vations to anywnere.
No change of plane
to EUROPE from
New York, Boston, Philadelphia... and
from Chicago and Detroit, starting April 30

properties.sfomuseum:description: Advertisement from April 3, 1954 issue of Saturday Evening Post promoting Pan American World Airways, titled “You’re on the most popular airline to Europe when you choose Pan American” with color image depicting inflight lounge scene aboard Boeing 377 Stratocruiser Clipper aircraft; includes abbreviated price chart to Europe.
